intro: Heliosperma pusillum var. candavicum, commonly known as the dwarf heliosperma, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces seeds that are dispersed by wind, and it is often found in coastal or inland areas with low rainfall. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
